# Hugo 做法

<!--
{% ... %} template tags
{{ ... }} template variables
以下敘述判斷 .toml 檔案中 params.UmamiAnalytics 的 enabled 值決定是否引入外部 html
-->

{{ if (.Site.Params.UmamiAnalytics.enabled ) }}
    {{ partial "umami_analytics.html" . }}
{{ end }}

# Google Analytics

  1. 建立 Google Analytics 帳戶
    • 帳戶名稱: (任意)
    • 屬性名稱: Github account(任意)
    • …
    • 平台類型選擇「網站」
    • 網站網址: https://vitaceae.github.io

  3. 覆蓋 Hugo 主題設定
    • 嵌入 gtag.js 到 anubis2 主題路徑 layouts/partials/google_analytics.html
    • hugo.toml 
      [params.GoogleAnalytics]
enabled = true
gtag = "G-P1Z223FHVN"

# Plugin: Giscus

  1. Select a repo as the database of the comments system
  2. Install giscus on the selected repo
  3. Enable GitHub Discussions
  4. Configure Giscus parameters

Add the configure parameters to .toml

GiscusRepo = "Vitaceae/vitaceae.github.io"
GiscusRepoId = "R_kgDOOLku4g"
GiscusDiscussionCategory = "General"
GiscusCategoryId = "DIC_kwDOOLku4s4CoQfG"
...

Take the theme anubis2 for example, the parameters will be used in layouts/partials/giscus.html and embedded to each .html files

item.author: i70170@hotmail.com (Mike Chang)
item.description:
# global-wise style 

<cust>
affected by <code>cust.scss</code> and <code>cust.css</code>
</cust>

<div class="cust-style">
example of <code>cust-style</code>
</div>
affected by cust.scss and cust.css
example of cust-style

add the following line to .toml

customCSS = ["custom-css/cust.scss", "custom-css/cust.css"]

add assets/custom-css/cust.css

.cust-style {
    background-color: pink;
    color: black;
    padding: 1em;
    border-radius: 0.3em;
    border: 1px solid black;
}

add assets/custom-css/cust.scss

@import 'foundation/vars';

cust {
    display: block;
    font: 100% $font-stack;
    color: $primary-color;
    background-color: $background-color;
    margin-top: 1em;
}

add assets/custom-css/foundation/_vars.scss

$font-stack: Helvetica, sans-serif;
$primary-color: rgb(255, 255, 168);
$background-color: rgb(85, 85, 85);

# page-wise style

the current page is affected only by hugo-style/style.css

add hugo-style/style.css

.cust-style2 {
    max-width: none;
    padding-left: 5em;
    padding-right: 5em;
    background-color: yellow;
}

example:

<style>
  @import 'style.css';
</style>

<div class="cust-style2">
example of <code>cust-style2</code>
</div>

item.title: Hugo
item.author: i70170@hotmail.com (Mike Chang)
item.description:
# Installation

## Windows

  • install chocolatey 
    > Set-ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Scope Process -Force; [System.Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol = [System.Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol -bor 3072; iex ((New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadString('https://community.chocolatey.org/install.ps1'))
  • install Go stable version: to build Hugo from source and use the Hugo Modules feature
    • from binary
    • from choco command 
      > choco install golang sass hugo-extended
  • install Dart Sass: to transpile Sass to CSS
  • install Hugo
    • from prebuilt-binary
      • add this directory to PATH variable
    • from choco command

## Linux 

$ sudo snap install hugo

# enable/revoke access to removable media
$ sudo snap connect hugo:removable-media
$ sudo snap disconnect hugo:removable-media

# enable/revoke access to SSH keys
$ sudo snap connect hugo:ssh-keys
$ sudo snap disconnect hugo:ssh-keys

# Directory structure

  • Hugo: Content organization
.
├── archetypes  # templates for new content
├── assets      # pipeline which global resources typically passed through
│                 (images, CSS, Sass, JavaScript, and TypeScript...)
├── config      # (optional)site configuration
│   ├── _default
│   │   ├── hugo.toml
│   │   ├── languages.toml
│   │   ├── menus.en.toml
│   │   └── params.toml
│   ├── production
│   │   ├── hugo.toml
│   │   └── params.toml
│   └── staging
│       └── ...
├── content     # markup files (typically markdown)
├── data        # JSON, TOML, YAML, or XML; accessible as a map in the .Site.Data variable
├── layouts     # templates to transform content, data, and resources into a complete website
├── resources   # cached output from Hugo's asset pipelines
├── static      # files that will be copied to the public directory
├── themes
└── hugo.toml

# Quick Start

  • Hugo: Basic usage
  • Windows user: run commands from PowerShell(not Windows PowerShell), WSL or Git Bash

## Create a demo site on WSL 

$ SITE_NAME=hugo_site
$ hugo new site $SITE_NAME
$ cd $SITE_NAME
$ git init

# add a new theme
$ git submodule add https://github.com/theNewDynamic/gohugo-theme-ananke.git themes/ananke
$ echo "theme = 'ananke'" >> hugo.toml

# write a new post; set 'draft = false' in the .md file when done
$ hugo new posts/new_post.md

# need to find the WSL's LAN IP; add an alias function in bash.rc
function hugo_server() {
    WSL_IP=$(ip addr show eth0 | grep "inet\b" | awk '{print $2}' | cut -d/ -f1)
    hugo server --bind $WSL_IP --baseURL=http://$WSL_IP -D -F --gc -w
}

# run local web server(changes take effect on the fly)
$ hugo_server

## Host on GitHub Pages

Publish to GitHub Pages (there’s rendering problem following the official method)

  1. add .github/workflows/hugo.yaml
  2. create a repo named github_user_name.github.io
  3. run hugo and push the contents in public to the repo
  4. GitHub repo::Settings::Pages::Github Actions::Deploy from a branch
  5. run https://github_user_name.github.io in web browser

## Problems

Error: error building site: html/template:_partials/disqus.html:1:12: no such template “_internal/disqus.html”

  • Hugo v0.147.0
  • refer to Embedded templates error #531

workaround

$ grep -rli '{{ template "_internal/disqus.html" . }}' * | xargs -i@ sed -i 's#{{ template "_internal/disqus.html" . }}#{{ partial "disqus.html" . }}#g' @
